name: Radisson Blu Edwardian Bloomsbury Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights recently at this Radisson over a weekend. The location speaks for itself - British Museum, tube stops, rail stations, Oxford st - all in the proximity of the hotel and add to its draw. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the side street - was very very quiet. A bit on the smaller side, but still good enough. The room was clean, bed comfortable and bath luxurious. We had the buffet breakfast, which was also excellent. The staff were courteous and very helpful to us (we were travelling with a baby). My only point of feedback is on the shower - the walls dont extend as much and if you are a big person (6 ft +), you may have water outside the stall - which can be mopped up. All in all, this was a great find. Thanks to previous TA reviewers. I give it a 5 star rating and would return in a heartbeat to this hotel or other Radisson Edwardian hotels.
reviews.title: All the reviews are true - this is a fantastic place to stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a great deal on this hotel via laterooms.com but would have happily paid more. The room was amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful. They even allowed us to leave our bags there after we had checked out. It's ideally located for the west end and is 2 minutes walk from the British Museum. Would happily stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location for West End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Left this review months go, it did not post. So here goes.....
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels Experiences!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our Concierge was exceptional (JL). We had a fifth floor corner suite that was truly spacious, comfortable, and modern. This hotel is 100 yards away from the British Museum, which is also a must see. The Bloomsbury is located in a great part of London, friendly and inviting.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We will absolutely return to this wonderful property.
reviews.title: Impeccable Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Very central hotel walking distance to most attractions and London nightlife. Service and staff are excellent. Free wifi and just a 2 minute stroll the Oxford Street shopping precinct. Nearest tube station is Tottenham Crt Rd just around the corner. Covent garden is a 10 minute walk as is the theatre district of Leicester Square. The only gripe is that breakfast is expensive but there are lots of alternative places just down the road. I would stay here again for both business and pleasure.
reviews.title: Location Location Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a first time London visitor I was not sure where to stay or what to expect from our visit. Several people familiar with the city suggested Russell Sq as a good area to stay in. I investigated multiple B&Bs, but saw so many negative reviews that I decided to pay more and stay at a full service hotel. The Radisson on Bloomsbury was highly recommended by a business colleague of mine. I went with his recommendation and was delighted with my experience.
reviews.title: Perfect Location - Wonderful Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a perfect location for getting around the city. We took the Tube from Heathrow to Holborn and had a 10 min walk to the hotel. We stayed in a 2nd floor room facing Bloomsbury St - I was initially concerned about possible street noise, but the person we spoke to when checking in said they have never had any complaints - and they were correct. We ended up with a very nice street view from our room - there was some street noise in the morning, but nothing that bothered us or disturbed our sleep.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel and wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The British Museum is 2 blks away. We walked to Piccadilly (15 min) - saw the Hockney show (fantastic!) at the Royal Academy, continued to Trafalgar Sq (10 min further) just enjoying being part of the crowds on the streets. The next day we walked to St James Park (25 min) and on to Westminster Abby, Big Ben, across the Waterloo Bridge to the Hayward Gallery. By late afternoon we had walked enough and took a bus back to Tottenham Court Rd, a few blocks from the hotel. Riding on the top level of a double-decker bus is another great way to get a good view and 'feel' for the city.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was a great experience - EVERY person on the staff was helpful, cordial and well informed! The lounge was a great place to unwind after a day of walking - reasonably priced (for London...) snacks and drinks with a contemporary, casual (but not obnoxiously hip) atmosphere.
reviews.title: London Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped in one of the suites which was amazing. Great location for sight-seeing etc Reception staff were very polite and helpful. Bar prices were expensive but presume in-line with London prices.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel/Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would certainly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: good room, but on noisy road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would have given this hotel a rating of 4 based on the room, which was smart, clean and had a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and good lighting. Overall it was let down by the noise- I realised when booking that the hotel is very central, and its position is great- but it is on a noisy road with loud traffic all night. The double glazing did give a good noise reduction- but the room was rather stuffy and I had to choose between open window with traffic noise, and air conditioning which was also quite noisy and not very efficient. Even the bathroom fan seemed to be on all the time, even with light off and door closed. I got a good deal at the last minute but would not have liked to pay full price for the night's sleep I got. But for location, it's great and staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Overall, pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location for most things in London. Right opposite the British Museum, just off Oxford street, close to theatres and the sights that tourists would want. A little expensive, but not overly, and it's central London after all. Free wifi, clean and safe just a very expensive lobby bar!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in the centre of London close to several tube lines and an easy walk to the theater district and attractions. The room was comfortable and clean and the bathroom was nice, although the bathroom door has a large panel of frosted glass in it which isn't very good when trying to use the bathroom at night without disturbing the other person in the room! We had a King Deluxe room but the view however was of the airconditioning plant and a brick wall. We didn't spend much time in the room so this wasn't much of an issue, but I would recommend that if you can spend more on a better view, do it. The only downside to what was otherwise a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, in an excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently made our second visit to this hotel. We were just as impressed as we had been the first time. The location is great. You can easily walk to all the West End theatres (the farthest is about 10 mins) , SOHO, Trafalgar Square, National Gallery and even the Millenium Wheel if you like a bit of a walk. Loads of great, reasonably priced restaurants in SOHO.
reviews.title: Great Location in West End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel cannot do enough to be helpful and are very polite. The Breakfast is very good also, with a help yourself hot buffet as well as all the usual continental selection. You can can also have the wait staff bring your cooked breakfast or pancakes or Eggs Benedict (there was a small extra charge for the Eggs Benedict).
reviews.title: just brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a litte small, but then they always are in London. But quite big enough for 2 people. Nice bathroom. The weekend package which includes breakfast and the in-house movie package is great. We really enjoyed the opportunity to have a little 'down-time' with a good movie. Overall, very nice and would certainly recommend it.
reviews.title: Noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three of us stayed in this wonderful hotel for two nights, in two fabulous rooms...The comfort of the bed plus superb bathroom was one of the best we have stayed, in London....The staff were all most obliging, courteous and friendly, food at breakfast and in the bar, excellent.Two perfect nights sleep completed the whole experience...we will be back...soon. Situation for the sights too, couldnt be better..short walk to the british museum and theatres....
reviews.title: excellent staff at Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a fantastic location and quality of the accomodation is second to none. Being in a central location comes at a price though and the noise of traffic in a first floor room overlooking the road is incessant. If you are a light sleeper ask for a different room or take ear plugs! Also take care at check in. We asked for a newspaper and were advised it was now pushed under the door and we would receive it by 8am. It was never ordered! We were also advised that when we used the £15 drinks voucher that came with the room the waitress would try and include a service charge and to advise her not to. We did this but still had to have a 5 minute conversation at check out a £3 charge before they accepted our explanation that we left a £1 to cover drinks that came to £16 and had not agreed to the service charge. None of this spolied the experience but it is not what you expect from a hotel of this quality
reviews.title: nice stay

aka: Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street Hotel London
description: In the heart of London's creative quarter, where Bloomsbury set writers, artists and thinkers once met, the newly transformed Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street Hotel offers an upscale experience at an affordable price, moments from the British Museum and nearby Covent Garden.
